member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.AddSPResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
One or more tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1":"value1", "key2":"value2"} }.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.AddSPResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.AddSPResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.AddSPResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Lists the tags for the specified resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Tags'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.ListTagsForResourceResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlanCmdlet
member.summary:
Describes the specified Savings Plans.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The filters.
The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of the Savings Plans.
The IDs of the Savings Plans.
The states.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve additional results, make another call with the returned token value.
The token for the next page of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlanCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'SavingsPlans'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlansResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlansResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlanCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlanRateCmdlet
member.summary:
Describes the specified Savings Plans rates.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The filters.
The ID of the Savings Plan.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve additional results, make another call with the returned token value.
The token for the next page of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlanRateCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlanRatesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlanRatesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlanRateCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the SavingsPlanId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^SavingsPlanId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlanRateCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlansOfferingCmdlet
member.summary:
Describes the specified Savings Plans offerings.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The currencies.
The descriptions.
The durations, in seconds.
The filters.
The IDs of the offerings.
The specific AWS operation for the line item in the billing report.
The payment options.
The plan type.
The product type.
The services.
The usage details of the line item in the billing report.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve additional results, make another call with the returned token value.
The token for the next page of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlansOfferingCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'SearchResults'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlansOfferingsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlansOfferingsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlansOfferingCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlansOfferingRateCmdlet
member.summary:
Describes the specified Savings Plans offering rates.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.

para.para: The filters.
The specific AWS operation for the line item in the billing report.
The AWS products.
The IDs of the offerings.
The payment options.
The plan types.
The services.
The usage details of the line item in the billing report.
The maximum number of results to return with a single call. To retrieve additional results, make another call with the returned token value.
The token for the next page of results.

summary.para:
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlansOfferingRateCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'SearchResults'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlansOfferingRatesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.DescribeSavingsPlansOfferingRatesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.GetSPSavingsPlansOfferingRateCmdlet.NoAutoIteration
member.summary: By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.NewSPSavingsPlanCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a Savings Plan.

para.para: The hourly commitment, in USD. This is a value between 0.001 and 1 million. You cannot specify more than three digits after the decimal point.
The ID of the offering.
One or more tags.
The up-front payment amount. This is a whole number between 50 and 99 percent of the total value of the Savings Plan. This parameter is supported only if the payment option is Partial Upfront.
Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.NewSPSavingsPlanCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'SavingsPlanId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.CreateSavingsPlanResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.CreateSavingsPlanResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.NewSPSavingsPlanCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the SavingsPlanOfferingId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^SavingsPlanOfferingId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.NewSPSavingsPlanCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.RemoveSPResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary: Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.

para.para: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
The tag keys.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.RemoveSPResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.SavingsPlans.Model.UntagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.RemoveSPResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ResourceArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ResourceArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.SP.RemoveSPResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
